premise: A man stands in a run-down looking area.
hypothesis: There is a man standing.
explanation_1: Sentence 1 describes a man standing in a certain area, while sentence two only focuses on the fact that the man is standing.

premise: A woman with a backpack sitting outside a building with others.
hypothesis: A woman sits with other people outdoors.
explanation_1: outside refers to outdoors.

premise: A little boy in a blue shirt and a little girl wearing pink playing in the green grass.
hypothesis: Two children are playing outdoors.
explanation_1: Children in green grass would be outdoors

premise: The black and white dog ran down the ramp.
hypothesis: The dog is running down the ramp.
explanation_1: The black and white dog is a dog.

premise: Men dressed up for some sort of event with huge smiles on their faces.
hypothesis: These men are happy.
explanation_1: People with huge smiles are happy.

premise: A brunette woman in a white lace dress holds a string and bow instrument as she sits in a chair.
hypothesis: The woman is sitting in a chair
explanation_1: One who sits is sitting.

premise: A man is parakiting on a body of water.
hypothesis: a person is being active
explanation_1: Parakiting is being active

premise: Two men are standing on a corner with empty rickshaws while people on bicycles ride by in the background.
hypothesis: Men are on the corner with their rickshaws.
explanation_1: Men are on the corner with their rickshaws means the same as men are on a corner with rickshaws.

premise: Two children are shown upside down.
hypothesis: Children are playing.
explanation_1: Two children are shown upside down does not imply they are playing.

premise: Well dressed man walks along a city street.
hypothesis: The man is outside.
explanation_1: Perhaps the street is not outside.

premise: A blond woman poses with a person in a pink costume.
hypothesis: A woman is posing with her friend.
explanation_1: A person is not necessarily a friend.

premise: A dog racing on a track.
hypothesis: a dog is racing vs other dogs
explanation_1: Not all dogs race other dogs.

premise: Three men, two who are conversing and one who is looking at the camera, sit outside a food stand.
hypothesis: Two men are having a conversation about food.
explanation_1: Two are conversing doesn't imply that their conversation is about food.

premise: A man is riding a dirt bike over some rocks.
hypothesis: The man is performing a trick for a show.
explanation_1: rocks is not the same as  show

premise: A city street with two ladies that have shopping bags in their hands with a crowd behind them.
hypothesis: The ladies just got done shopping and are walking home.
explanation_1: We do not know if the women just got done shopping or even if they are done at all, and we do not know if they are walking home or going someplace else.

premise: Three men in white shirts dance and sing on a stage as a group of women watch from the sidelines.
hypothesis: Some men are performing to raise money
explanation_1: The Men can perform for other reasons than to raise money

premise: A Caucasian woman, wearing a black and orange dress, is standing in front of a music stand.
hypothesis: A woman is sitting down at a table.
explanation_1: Standing (upright) and sitting down are mutually exclusive states of being.

premise: A little girl pushes a merry-go-round in a park while two other kids hold on. ee
hypothesis: A little boy is outside
explanation_1: Girl and boy are different genders

premise: A man is sitting on steps outside.
hypothesis: the man is standing
explanation_1: Sitting not possible while standing.

premise: A team of dogs pulls a sled through the snow.
hypothesis: The dogs are swimming in the ocean
explanation_1: Contradictory mention of dogs swimming in ocean against dogs pulling sleds in the snow in first sentence.

premise: Men with their backs to the viewer and wearing orange vests with "la cgt" written on them march together.
hypothesis: A group of adults doing a charity game of basketball.
explanation_1: In the first sentence it talks about men who march together  and in the second sentence a group of adults, men or women are not mentioned, are doing a charity game.

premise: Two contractors at work behind a white mailbox.
hypothesis: Two men eating lunch at a deli.
explanation_1: Behind a white mailbox and deli are different places. the men cannot be at work and eating lunch at the same time.

premise: A person reaches for a large gray dog while a black dog trails.
hypothesis: A person is riding a bike in a dog park
explanation_1: The person can't be riding a bike and reaching for a dog at the same time.

premise: A woman under a bright umbrella is holding a young boy and tucking her hair behind her ear.
hypothesis: A woman and her son are playing in the ocean.
explanation_1: The woman is either using her hands to hold a young boy under the umbrella or playing with him in the ocean.
